attributes.action: A memorial in the National Arboretum to frontline workers who've died from covid
attributes.additional_details: It is a national response to a national tragedy.
attributes.background: At this most difficult of times I think it would be fitting to have a memorial in the National Arboretum to honour all those brave, compassionate and selfless frontline workers, be they doctors, nurses, carers, bus drivers or suppliers of essential services who have died as a result of covid-19.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions calling for requests for the Government to establish memorials in a particular location, as this would need to be conducted in agreement with the body responsible for that location, but you might like to sign these petitions calling for a similar action:

You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Fund the creation of a Coronovirus Remembrance Forest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314071

Commission & fund a National Pandemic Memorial, Institute & annual commemoration: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314589

Create a National Covid-19 Key worker memorial Commemorate the fallen: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315516
